item.title: Quotient Set
item.description: Motivation & Definition Universal Property Fix an equivalence relation $E$ on $X$. We would like to construct a set $X/E$ and a function $\pi:X\to X/E$ in which ‘$E$ becomes equality’ via $\pi$. Moreover, this construction needs to be universal, in the precise sense that: For any set $Z$ and any function $f:X\to Z$ such that $xEy$ implies $f(x)=f(y)$ for all $x,y\in X$, there is a unique function $f’:X/E\to Z$ such that $f=f’\circ\pi$.
